name: Bullet Point Style
description: Uses scannable bullet points to highlight key benefits or features. Perfect for busy executives who skim emails. The format makes value props instantly digestible.
guidelines: Start with personalization showing you did research
Ask a relevant pain-point question early
Use exactly 3 bullet points - no more, no less
Each bullet should be a distinct, specific benefit
Include numbers, metrics, or specifics in bullets when possible
End with ONE line of social proof (if available) + soft CTA
Keep the whole email under 80 words
Bullets should be scannable in 2 seconds
Don't use generic bullet points - be specific to their situation

examples.context: CTV advertising platform reaching out to healthcare company
examples.subject: streaming patients
examples.body:
Hi Sarah,
Saw Orthology competing in Minnesota metro areas. Quick question: Are you struggling with rising patient acquisition costs?
Our CTV platform reaches streaming patients without traditional TV complexity:

• Target Minneapolis ZIPs (725K households in network)
• See which networks deliver real patient inquiries
• Access Hulu, Disney, ESPN at $15-35 CPMs

EHE Health achieved 2.1 ROAS tracking appointments directly from CTV campaigns.
Worth exploring?
examples.whyItWorks: Opens with specific research (Minnesota metro), asks a pain-point question, then delivers 3 scannable benefits with real numbers. Ends with verified social proof and soft CTA.

examples.context: Sales automation tool reaching out to growing sales team
examples.subject: scaling outbound
examples.body:
Hi Marcus,
Noticed TechForce just opened 3 new territories. Quick question: Is your current outbound process ready to scale?

We help sales teams 3x their pipeline without adding headcount:

• Auto-personalize 1,000+ emails/day using AI
• Sync directly with Salesforce (no manual entry)
• A/B test subject lines with real-time analytics

Dropbox's SDR team cut prospecting time 65%.
Open to a quick demo?
examples.whyItWorks: Shows awareness of their growth, asks scaling question, bullets focus on specific capabilities with numbers. Social proof from recognizable company.

examples.context: Cybersecurity firm reaching out to fintech company
examples.subject: compliance question
examples.body:
Hi Jennifer,
Saw PayFlow processing $2B+ annually. Quick thought: Are you confident your SOC 2 audit will go smoothly next quarter?

We help fintech teams stay audit-ready year-round:

• Continuous compliance monitoring (not point-in-time)
• Auto-generate evidence for 90% of SOC 2 controls
• 48-hour gap assessment to find issues early

Stripe's compliance team cut audit prep from 8 weeks to 2.
Worth a conversation?
examples.whyItWorks: References specific business metric ($2B), asks timely compliance question, bullets are specific to fintech compliance needs. Strong social proof.

promptTemplate: Write a scannable bullet-point email that busy executives can digest in 10 seconds. Structure: personalized opener with research → pain-point question → brief context → 3 SPECIFIC bullet points with numbers/metrics → one line of verified social proof (only if provided) → soft CTA. Each bullet must be distinct and valuable on its own. The bullets are the star - make them compelling and specific.
